intro: Aylostera brunneoradicata, commonly known as the brown-root aylostera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its root system is notable for its deep, brownish coloration, which contributes to its common name. Aylostera brunneoradicata is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
